text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Dreamcast is a home video game console developed by Sega, succeeding the Saturn. It launched in November 1998 in Japan, offering online connectivity before the PS2 and Xbox did. The Dreamcast would be discontinued in 2004 with Sega withdrawing from the console market due to being unable to meet sales expectations. It's equipped with a 32-bit processor which includes a 128-bit arithmetic coprocessor, 16MB of RAM and a NEC PowerVR GPU which could display up to 3-6 million polygons per second and 16.77 million colors simultaneously. The NAOMI arcade board uses nearly identical hardware to the Dreamcast.
